content.description:
This route climbs the center of the large slab at the gate to the campground. Many variations exist, but my favorite is straight up the middle, all the way to the top. Perfectly solid rock with many features that take an assortment of nuts and cams.

First bit is maybe the crux, flaring diagonal crack is weird to protect, but it's easy enough to climb through to the first good gear placement at 15ft.

At this point, traverse right a few feet to some shallow huecos and climb up to the next diagonal crack. Follow the crack for a bit then go up to a low angle slab.

For the final bit, climb into the right facing dihedral and build your anchor in the corner at the very top.

The center route is the longest(and best)climb, but climbing the right or left side of the slab is quite pleasant as well.
content.protection: Set of small to med nuts, and cams from .5 up to 3. Bring extra #2 and #1, along with a long bit of webbing to built an anchor
content.location: Walk up to the grove of aspens at the base of the slab and start more or less up the left leaning crack. The crack itself is a little dirty, so I usually find myself climbing a little to the left. Walk down off those side.

content.description:
Really cool boulder!!!

Can also be climbed a variety of ways, center line is best.

Start towards the left side on a big sloper and work your way right through sidepulls and crimps before topping out over the center of the boulder.

A problem also exists on the left side, climbing the arete(v2)
content.location: Up towards the top of the hill behind the bathroom. Walk about 50 yards or so to the right of Host With the Most.

content.description:
Excellent slab climbing, utilizing a variety of holds. Although it's low angle, the start is thin and tricky, but can be made easier by using the flake on the right(knocks the grade down).

At 3/4 height, you encounter a short roof crux and must make an awkward reach up to jugs above the lip.
content.protection: Long slings for anchors on top. I hope to equip the route with bolts within the next year or so.
content.location: From the bathrooms across from site 3, walk straight up to the cliffs inning the top of the hill. Anchors can be set up by walking around the right side and slinging two or three lodge pole pines.

content.description:
Fun little route in between the main slab and Host With The Most.

Start in a wide crack, then move into shallow hueco crimps at the top.

A 5.9 line climbs up the right side of Beam using tiny crimps which is very fun as well
content.protection: Long slings- we used a second rope to tie off on trees about 10ft behind the lip and backed it up with a slung boulder. Hoping to equip this one with bots within the next year or so.
content.location: About 100ft left of Host With The Most. Climb a short boulder to get to the base of the route

content.description:
Several problems exist on this short boulder.

Start sitting under the big ledge and power your way up using edges and slopers at the lip. Hard topout

Alternatively, from the ledge, move right along crimps and round the corner to top out on good holds. (harder than the center problem)
content.protection: pad and spotter. good landing though
content.location: Right up the hill from the upper bathroom
